channel.title: Introduction to Algorithms on Mr. Pointing
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction to Algorithms on Mr. Pointing

item.title: Appendix A
item.description: Summations As we know, we analyze algorithms by their running time. When algorithms use for or while loops (iterative structures), the running time is expressed as the sum of all the times spent on execution. Summation Formulas and Properties Say we have $a_1,a_2,…a_n$ numbers, what we call a sequence. While $n$ is a non-negative integer, we can say the sum of that set is $\sum_{k=1}^{n}a_k$. If $n=0$, value is 0.
